title: xgboost
description: Performs label transfer from reference to query using XGBoost classifier

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`. The query data in
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`. The query data in .h5mu format with predicted labels transfered from the reference.

output_obs_predictions.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `
output_obs_predictions.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `.obs` slots to store the predicted information.
If provided, must have the same length as `--reference_obs_targets`.
If empty, will default to the `reference_obs_targets` combined with the `"_pred"` suffix.

output_obs_uncertainty.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `
output_obs_uncertainty.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `.obs` slots to store the uncertainty of the predictions.
If provided, must have the same length as `--reference_obs_targets`.
If empty, will default to the `reference_obs_targets` combined with the `"_uncertainty"` suffix.

output_uns_parameters.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `labels_transfer`. The `.uns` key to store additional information about the parameters used for the label transfer.

input.description: Type: `file`, required. The query data to transfer the labels to
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required. The query data to transfer the labels to. Should be a .h5mu file.

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to use
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to use.

input_obsm_features.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `X_integrated_scanvi`. The `.obsm` key of the embedding to use for the classifier's inference. If not provided, the `.X` slot will be used instead.
Make sure that embedding was obtained in the same way as the reference embedding (e.g. by the same model or preprocessing).

reference.description: Type: `file`, example: `https:/zenodo.org/record/6337966/files/HLCA_emb_and_metadata.h5ad`. The reference data to train classifiers on
reference.help_text: Type: `file`, example: `https:/zenodo.org/record/6337966/files/HLCA_emb_and_metadata.h5ad`. The reference data to train classifiers on.

reference_obsm_features.help_text:
Type: `string`, required, default: `X_integrated_scanvi`. The `.obsm` key of the embedding to use for the classifier's training.
Make sure that embedding was obtained in the same way as the query embedding (e.g. by the same model or preprocessing).

reference_obs_targets.description: Type: List of `string`, default: `ann_level_1;ann_level_2;ann_level_3;ann_level_4;ann_level_5;ann_finest_level`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The `
reference_obs_targets.help_text: Type: List of `string`, default: `ann_level_1;ann_level_2;ann_level_3;ann_level_4;ann_level_5;ann_finest_level`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The `.obs` key of the target labels to tranfer.

force_retrain.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Retrain models on the reference even if model_output directory already has trained classifiers
force_retrain.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Retrain models on the reference even if model_output directory already has trained classifiers. WARNING! It will rewrite existing classifiers for targets in the model_output directory!

use_gpu.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `false`. Use GPU during models training and inference (recommended)
use_gpu.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `false`. Use GPU during models training and inference (recommended).

verbosity.description: Type: `integer`, default: `1`. The verbosity level for evaluation of the classifier from the range [0,2]
verbosity.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `1`. The verbosity level for evaluation of the classifier from the range [0,2]

model_output.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.model_output.model_output`. Output directory for model
model_output.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.model_output.model_output`. Output directory for model

learning_rate.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.3`. Step size shrinkage used in update to prevents overfitting
learning_rate.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.3`. Step size shrinkage used in update to prevents overfitting. Range: [0,1]. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

min_split_loss.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. Minimum loss reduction required to make a further partition on a leaf node of the tree
min_split_loss.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. Minimum loss reduction required to make a further partition on a leaf node of the tree. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

max_depth.description: Type: `integer`, default: `6`. Maximum depth of a tree
max_depth.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `6`. Maximum depth of a tree. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

min_child_weight.description: Type: `integer`, default: `1`. Minimum sum of instance weight (hessian) needed in a child
min_child_weight.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `1`. Minimum sum of instance weight (hessian) needed in a child. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

max_delta_step.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. Maximum delta step we allow each leaf output to be
max_delta_step.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. Maximum delta step we allow each leaf output to be. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

subsample.description: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Subsample ratio of the training instances
subsample.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Subsample ratio of the training instances. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

sampling_method.description: Type: `string`, default: `uniform`, choices: ``uniform`, `gradient_based``. The method to use to sample the training instances
sampling_method.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `uniform`, choices: ``uniform`, `gradient_based``. The method to use to sample the training instances. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

colsample_bytree.description: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Fraction of columns to be subsampled
colsample_bytree.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Fraction of columns to be subsampled. Range (0, 1]. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

colsample_bylevel.description: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Subsample ratio of columns for each level
colsample_bylevel.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Subsample ratio of columns for each level. Range (0, 1]. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

colsample_bynode.description: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Subsample ratio of columns for each node (split)
colsample_bynode.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Subsample ratio of columns for each node (split). Range (0, 1]. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

reg_lambda.description: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. L2 regularization term on weights
reg_lambda.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. L2 regularization term on weights. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

reg_alpha.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. L1 regularization term on weights
reg_alpha.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. L1 regularization term on weights. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

scale_pos_weight.description: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Control the balance of positive and negative weights, useful for unbalanced classes
scale_pos_weight.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `1.0`. Control the balance of positive and negative weights, useful for unbalanced classes. See https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parameter.html#parameters-for-tree-booster for the reference

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
